aria-allowed-role-1.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-1.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <input type="checkbox" id="main-menu-input" class="toggle-list__checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false" aria-labelledby="mw-mf-main-menu-button">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

aria-valid-attr-value-2.title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not have valid values
aria-valid-attr-value-2.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more about valid values for ARIA attributes](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-valid-attr-value).

items.snippet: <a id="ca-watch" href="/en/wiki/index.php?title=Special:UserLogin&returnto=Central+America" class="mw-ui-icon mw-ui-icon-element mw-ui-icon-wikimedia-star-base20 mw-ui-icon-…" data-mw="interface" data-event-name="menu.watch" role="button" aria-controls="mw-watchlink-notification">
items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Invalid ARIA attribute value: aria-controls="mw-watchlink-notification"

color-contrast-3.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
color-contrast-3.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

heading-order-4.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
heading-order-4.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

list-5.title: Lists do not contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
list-5.description: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/list).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  List element has direct children that are not allowed: b, ul

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  List element has direct children that are not allowed: #text, a, ul

target-size-6.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
target-size-6.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (198.3px by 21px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 21px instead of at least 24px.
